720751f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Franklin Street
720751f-a.text:
Lafayette Street, east side, between Franklin and Leonard Streets. The view shows the Lafayette Street entrance to the City Prison, also
known as "The Tombs".
About 1925.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.  neg 2~ G SS
720751f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY

720752f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Franklin Street
720752f-a.text:
Lafayette Street, east side, south from but not including Franklin, to and including Leonard Streets. Also shown is Leonard Street, north side, east from Lafayette, to and including Centre Streets. This view shows the City Prison, known as "The Tomba" which name arose from its gloomy associations. Built in 1840.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
720752f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY

720753f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Franklin Street
720753f-a.text:
LLafayette Street, at the S.E. corner of F-anklin Street, and shoting The Tombs, a prison with its "8ridge of Sighs" connecting it to the Criminad Court Building; which is not shown, but would be on the extreme left. On the right appears a portion of the new Board of Health Building. Distinctly seen, under the afore mentioned "bridge" is the S.E. corner of Centre and
Franklin Streets.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writere Project.
720753f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY

719889f-a.title: Manhattan: Franklin Street - Lafayette Street
719889f-a.text:
Franklin Street (center to right), south side, west from Lafayette (left foreground) Street. The corner building bears No. 4 Franklin Street; the three 27. story structures between the Eagle Building (New York Telephone Company) and same,being No's 45 to 49 inclusive. The 2 story addition to the corner building is known as
No. 64 Lafayette Street.
February 25, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.
719889f-a.folder: Franklin Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY
